column4: Anybody else have this problem with Azureus? I set it to open my torrents, but when I double click them it loads but does nothing.
Same deal in firefox.
I physically have to go File > Open Torrent
Oh shit wrong channel
hahaha
But if anyone knows, let me know.
Cause its very annoying.
write a script taht strips out the "file://" part that gets passed to azureus
ubuntuforums has a thread about it
Do know what the title is so I can keyword it? Or do you have a link?
not offhand, no.  If you can't find it, ping me and I'll search
I've done about 12 searches and haven't found anything.

ugh I wish people on the forums would press "search" instead of starting new topic, now I have to wade through hundreds of threads with the same exact issue and find the one with the solution explained... Can you try this in a terminal first:  azureuous /path/to/torrent    does that work?
I know what you mean, I've been doing the same thing haha. At least you know what you're looking for.
I can explain to you the solution, it will be faster.  But check that that command works first, so we can make sure it's the same issue.
then it must be a different issue than what I knew about
Well basically, the files are associated with azureus but when double clicked they don't get imported.
I just tried here and azureus core dumps on me if I give it the path to a torrent
did you give the absolute path to azureus?
I even renamed it to something simple.
hmm, it works here when I do: azureus /home/jrib/torrents/foo.torrent     but not if I do: azureus foo.torrent
what out do you get in the terminal?  Does azureus give any gui notification that a file was passed?
azureus /home/brendan/Desktop/torrent.torrent
what version of ubuntu?
